Class TriggerLogicBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • LogicBlock
      • TriggerLogicBlock

  • public class TriggerLogicBlock
extends LogicBlock
    A TriggerLogicBlock is a LogicBlock that represents a trigger occurring in the system.

    Each TriggerLogicBlock consists of the Peripheral on which the trigger occurred and the triggerString that represents the trigger on the Peripheral.

    When the trigger represented by this block occurs in the system, the update method of this block will be called and the boolean value of the trigger value will be passed to the method. The update method updates the output value of this TriggerLogicBlock to the newTriggerValue and then calls the update method of all LogicBlock objects in nextBlocks.

    The prevBlocks list of a TriggerLogicBlock is always empty.

    Author:
    Shawn Koop

      • addPrevBlock

        public void addPrevBlock(LogicBlock block)
        This method overrides the addPrevBlock method in LogicBlock so that the method does nothing because TriggerLogicBlock objects have no previous blocks.

        The addPrevBlock method of a TriggerLogicBlock should never be called but this is implemented as a safeguard in case someone tries.

        Overrides:
        addPrevBlock in class LogicBlock
        Parameters:
        block - This field is not used and can be left null.

      • update

        public void update(boolean newTriggerValue)
        This method updates the output value of this TriggerLogicBlock to the newTriggerValue and then calls the update method of all LogicBlock objects in nextBlocks.
        Specified by:
        update in class LogicBlock
        Parameters:
        newTriggerValue - The boolean value to update this TriggerLogicBlock to.
